lead_paragraph: The Obama administration has spent billions on getting doctors and hospitals to computerize patient records, but not everyone is playing along.

headline.print_headline: Tech Rivalries Impede Digital Medical Record Sharing
headline.main: Tech Rivalries Impede Digital Medical Record Sharing

snippet: The Obama administration has spent billions on getting doctors and hospitals to computerize patient records, but not everyone is playing along.
abstract: National coordinator for health information technology Dr Karen B DeSalvo issues report to Congress about obstacles to freer flow of health information between hospitals and doctors regarding electronic patient records; some doctors, hospitals, tech companies and labs are purposely blocking exchange of electronic health information out of fear of losing business.
